column1: Quevedo is a city in Ecuador located in the Los Rios Province. It is the seat of Quevedo Canton
column2: a vibrant community founded in 1943. According to the latest census
column4: 000. Located at 237 km SW of Quito (Ecuador's capital)
column6: 183 km NE of Guayaquil (Ecuador's main port). Quevedo is one of the fastest growing cities in Ecuador and it is mainly known for its agricultural tradition. Quevedo's agroindustrial complex is one of the leading exporters in the world of banana
column8: passion fruit and coffee bean. In recent years non-agricultural activities have experienced significant progress mainly in the financial and educational sectors.

column2: Quevedo's geographic location makes it an important logistics link between the Pacific coastal area's main population centers like Guayaquil
column3: Santo Domingo and Manta and cities in the Andes highlands such as Ambato and Quito. Because of its location west of the Andes mountains and right next to the  Vinces River (a major waterway and tributary to the Pacific Ocean)
column4: the city is vulnerable to flooding.

column1: Quevedo is one of the most important agricultural centers of Ecuador and is the geographical point where all major roads (including the Pan-American highway) in the region intersect. The area surrounding Quevedo mainly produce bananas
column4: and soybeans. The alluvial soils in the region generate excellent harvests year-round. Many banana producers complement their banana plantations with fields that produce corn
column5: soy and rice in the wet season. In the city
column6: this produce is often industrialized into super-market ready products
column9: noodles and other traditionally Asian foods. In recent years
column10: Quevedo agro-industrial complex has added value to its output by developing a strong presence in the organic product's niche both locally and overseas.

column1: Quevedo has a tropical wet climate

column3: is well known in Ecuador for its program in Agricultural sciences.

column1: Club Deportivo Quevedo is the local football team which has played in the Ecuadorian top division.

Mostly populated by the mestizo ethnic group; Quevedo is also known for its prominent Chinese immigrant population and has even been called the "Chinatown of Ecuador". This gives it a distinct reputation and cultural feeling in relation to other Ecuadorian cities.  Quevedo is also the center of the "montubio" folklore
column2: a sub-culture that emanates from the customs of the early settlers of the region
column4: a word that describes the agricultural fields.

column1: The city celebrates its foundation on October 7.
